reviews.review_msg: I found the class tedious and boring- he would just read over poetry forever in monotone. We all had to give 20-25 minute presentations which took up a lot of class time and were a waste of time. BUT he is a very easy marker. If you can handle extremely boring classes, then take him just for the marking.

I think I know how you've come to interpret him as a pompous personality, but that impression isn't all the way to his core.  There is a sense of humour there and, if you pay close enough attention, even some self-deprecation.
Nadine was my prof for the first class I took at SFU.  I was really nervous about taking classes at a university level, but her class was interesting and fun.  I think she is a great prof.
Really nice prof. Go to her office hours, this will bring your mark up. Readings very heavy, but it's upper level english after all

Had us spend $25 on a book, then we chose poems...much better than buying expensive books!  Her grading scheme is great.  First year students on here should accept her eccentricities...she's a great prof!  She cares more about teaching than a lot of the other profs I had.
